Key Arguments: The proposed ACMA powers threaten free speech, which is fundamental to democracy.
Suppression of free speech stifles intellectual progress and societal advancement.
The legislation could lead to authoritarianism by silencing dissenting voices.
It may create echo chambers and increase societal polarization.
Free speech is crucial for social progress and challenging societal norms.
Suppressing free speech can have negative emotional and psychological impacts on individuals.
Notable Quotes: The proposed new ACMA powers would mean the acceleration of Australia’s decent into a Communist ideology where the Government is the only source of truth.

Who decides what is misinformation and disinformation? If you delve into the financial incentives provided to fact checking organisations by Government and social media companies it becomes clear that ‘truth’ can be bought.
The proposed increase in ACMA powers is a mechanism of control to suppress free speech and institute a ‘Ministry of Truth’.
